required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Popliteal Artery of Treatment With Balloon Angioplasty vs. SUPERA VERITAS Peripheral Stent System
clinical_study.official_title: Popliteal Artery Trial of Patients Undergoing Treatment With Balloon Angioplasty vs. the Adaptive SUPERA VERITAS Peripheral Stent System

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: Unblinded, randomized, balanced trial comparing 12 month target lesion patency rates of the IDEV SUPERA VERITAS peripheral stent system to PTA in the treatment of obstructive atherosclerotic popliteal artery disease.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.description: Primary efficacy will be target lesion primary patency at 12 months.

secondary_outcome.description: Major Adverse Event-free survival rate that is non-inferior to that of PTA at 12 months.

arm_group.description: Following PTA of the target lesion, the SUPERA stent will be delivered to the treated segment.
The target lesion will be treated by PTA alone.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject has lifestyle limiting claudication or rest pain or at least a single de novo or restenotic popliteal artery lesion.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inteervention distal to the target lesion is required at the time of the index procedure or within 30 days after the index procedure.
